comments.text:
Ha. You think the movies like this one gave Superman some really weird 
powers you don't know much. George Reeves' Superman in the 50's T.V. show 
literally separated his molecules to walk through walls, traveled over 
telephone lines, became invisible, and split in two while retaining his 
traditional powers of X-ray vision, microscopic vision, super-typing, 
super-hearing, super-breath, super-strength, flying, and a mastery of 
foreign languages.﻿
comments.author: Chris Duncan

comments.text:
Thank God they erased those powers in later incarnations. I prefer a

score of 90-something and an average rating of...6.

"And LOL for the first season of AoS having only 3.7/5  for average

I love how I went through many different media explaining why Marvel is 
more popular and you're like "EW NO DC IS BETTER BECAUSE I WATCHED IT WHEN 
I WAS 8"
comments.author: Unshaved Stuff

comments.text:
+trackak0s21
 "And was Marvel and their characters popular before the movies"
Bitch I just mentioned the X-Men, Spider-Man and Hulk.

Uh, who's talking about quality here, shitboy? I never said Spider-Man and 
X-Men TAS were better than Batmin. I'm talking about popularity.
Funny how you didn't mention Toddler Titans Go Home, though.

"http://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_television_series_based_on_DC_Comics

Here is your list. Yes there were tv shows before the "Rise" of your 
beloved MCU"

um
ok
what is that list going to tell me about live action Marvel shows though.

"Besides, what marvel has now are two shows about boring fucking agents. No 
doubt daredevil is gonna be good. I love DD. But agents??? Really? AoS is 
still on the air because it has the "marvel" on the title."
"I care about quality"
clearly

"And DC actually plan their shows on *tv* instead of just throwing 
miniseries on netflix"
"I care about *quality*"
clearly

"I dont even care who is more popular"
I am, that's what I'm talking about. Again, I'm not talking about quality 
because that's a different matter altogether. In case it wasn't obvious by 
the fact that I mentioned relevance, this is about relevance, videogames 
don't represent that. They're still a somewhat niche market.
And yes, DC makes better games now. Keyword: *Now.* That can't be argued.
comments.author: Unshaved Stuff

comments.text:
+Unshaved Stuff and was marvel or their characters that popular before the 
movies? No i dont think so.

Does marvel even tries to make cartoons now? 
What about Justice league series? Teen titans? Batman freaking beyond? 
Young justice? Do i have to mention the animated movies too? Marvel may had 
some good cartoons at that department but right now they are dead.

http://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_television_series_based_on_DC_Comics

Here is your list. Yes there were tv shows before the "Rise" of your 
beloved MCU.
Besides, what marvel has now are two shows about boring fucking agents. No 
doubt daredevil is gonna be good. I love DD. But agents??? Really? AoS is 
still on the air because it has the "marvel" on the title.
And DC actually plan their shows on tv instead of just throwing miniseries 
on netflix.
I dont even care who is more popular. Marvel obviously is. I care about 
quality. And marvel lacks on that department.
You are also forgetting about videogames
comments.author: trackak0s21

comments.text:
+trackak0s21 Let's see...
Comics: Has been selling more than DC since the 70s.
Cartoons: X-Men and Spider-Man TAS were EVERYWHERE in the 90s. And before 
it you mention it, Batman TAS was more of a cult classic. It was never 
amazingly popular.
Live action TV shows: ...Were there even any before the rise of the MCU?
I guess there's The Incredible Hulk. That one's the main reason Hulk is so 
popular with the general audience.

DC: Made Batman and Superman. Woo.
